msContents.summary: The ninth of fourteen large volumes of an illuminated Qu'ran manuscript with interlinear literal translations in Persian and Chagatay Turkish. The set would originally have comprised 30 volumes. This volume contains parts of Juz' 22 but with many gaps.

msItem.title: al-Qurʼān
القران
Juz' 22
msItem.textLang: Arabic, with interlinear translations in Persian and Chagatai Turkish

layoutDesc.layout: 1 column with three lines of Arabic script, the Persian and Turkish translations below.

handDesc.handNote: The Arabic text is in large Naskh characters fully vowelled, perhaps of the 15th century. The Persian and Turkish translations are both written in smaller characters in the same hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Divisions are marked with illuminated pages and ornaments.

history.origin: 14th century, possibly produced in Transoxiana (A. Ata narrows it down to the Ispicab region; see Ata 2020).

provenance.p: Formerly in the collection of Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford (1812–1880).
Purchased by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1901 from James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford (1847–1913).

acquisition.p: Bequeathed by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1908 to the John Rylands Library.

recordHist.source: Catalogue information compiled by Elizabeth Gow from Alphonse Mingana, Catalogue of the Arabic Manuscripts in the John Rylands Library, Manchester University Press, 1934.

availability.p: To book an in-person or online appointment to consult the manuscript, visit Using the Special Collections Reading Rooms. For any other enquiries please email uml.special-collections@manchester.ac.uk.
